intro: Aspidium sporadosorum, commonly known as the common water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments, often found near streams, marshes, and damp woodlands. Its reproductive structures, known as sporangia, are clustered on the undersides of the fronds. Aspidium sporadosorum plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for small aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
